title: OidcClient: Getting exception when trying to use tokenHelper
body:
### Describe the bug

When Following Quarkus doc guide at section
https://quarkus.io/version/main/guides/security-openid-connect-client-reference#use-oidc-client-directly

and using within a project 
-RestClientWithTokenHeaderParam.java
-OidcClientResource.java

I am getting a exception when using command:
curl localhost:8080/service/user-name

	

### Expected behavior

When following the current quarkus guide section  _OIDC client directly_,  it is generating en an exception.

The expectation is to provide a doc example which can be executed successfully (or even better - adding a new example to the quickstart) showcasing how to doing it.

### Actual behavior

```

```


### How to Reproduce?

step 1:
clone quarkus-quickstart

step 2:
go to directory

quarkus-quickstarts/security-openid-connect-client-quickstart


step3:

Add both files (copied from from the quarkus guide _use Oidc directly section_
https://quarkus.io/version/main/guides/security-openid-connect-client-reference#use-oidc-client-directly


```java
package org.acme.security.openid.connect.client;

import org.eclipse.microprofile.rest.client.inject.RegisterRestClient;

import io.smallrye.mutiny.Uni;
import jakarta.ws.rs.GET;
import jakarta.ws.rs.HeaderParam;
import jakarta.ws.rs.Path;
import jakarta.ws.rs.Produces;

@RegisterRestClient
@Path("/")
public interface RestClientWithTokenHeaderParam {

    @GET
    @Produces("text/plain")
    @Path("userName")
    Uni<String> getUserName(@HeaderParam("Authorization") String authorization);
}
```

and 

```java
package org.acme.security.openid.connect.client;

import org.eclipse.microprofile.rest.client.inject.RestClient;

import io.quarkus.oidc.client.runtime.TokensHelper;
import io.quarkus.oidc.client.OidcClient;

import io.smallrye.mutiny.Uni;
import jakarta.inject.Inject;
import jakarta.ws.rs.GET;
import jakarta.ws.rs.Path;
import jakarta.ws.rs.Produces;

@Path("/service")
public class OidcClientResource {

    @Inject
    OidcClient client;
    TokensHelper tokenHelper = new TokensHelper(); 

    @Inject
    @RestClient
    RestClientWithTokenHeaderParam restClient;

    @GET
    @Path("user-name")
    @Produces("text/plain")
    public Uni<String> getUserName() {
    	return tokenHelper.getTokens(client).onItem()
        		.transformToUni(tokens -> restClient.getUserName("Bearer " + tokens.getAccessToken()));
    }
}
```

step4
Launch quarkus

mvn quarkus:dev


step 5:
Run command:

```
curl localhost:8080/service/user-name
```

===> It will trigger the exception mentioned earlier

```
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unable to determine the proper baseUrl/baseUri. Consider registering using @RegisterRestClient(baseUri="someuri"), @RegisterRestClient(configKey="orkey"), or by adding 'quarkus.rest-client."org.acme.security.openid.connect.client.RestClientWithTokenHeaderParam".url' or 'quarkus.rest-client."org.acme.security.openid.connect.client.RestClientWithTokenHeaderParam".uri' to your Quarkus configuration
	at io.quarkus.rest.client.reactive.runtime.RestClientCDIDelegateBuilder.configureBaseUrl(RestClientCDIDelegateBuilder.java:387)
```
